bibl.title: Letter from Frank Carey to Philip Showalter Hench, May 26, 1950

div1.p: Carey plans an article on Reed and yellow fever research. He wants to know what triggered Hench's interest in Reed's work. Carey inquires what kind of plans have been made for the preservation of Building No. 1 at Camp Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Frank Carey to Philip Showalter Hench, May 26, 1950
div1.opener:
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS
330 STAR BUILDING
WASHINGTON 4, D. C.
May 26, 1950
DR. PHILIP S. HENCH,
MAYO CLINIC,
ROCHESTER, MINN.
DEAR DR. HENCH:
div1.p:
I'M PLANNING AN ARTICLE ON WALTER REED AND THE YELLOW
FEVER RESEARCH, AND I HAVE READ YOUR EXCELLENT ACCOUNT GIVEN BEFORE
THE FOURTH INTERNATIONAL CONGRESS ON TROPICAL MEDICINE AND MALARIA
HERE IN WASHINGTON. I'VE ALSO TALKED TO GENERAL KEAN, TO WALTER
REED'S SON AND OTHERS.

I'M INTERESTED IN LEARNING HOW IT WAS THAT YOU BECAME
SO INTENSELY INTERESTED IN THIS SUBJECT. GENERAL KEAN TELLS ME HE
BELIEVES YOU ATTENDED THE SAME COLLEGE FROM WHICH DR. LAZEAR WAS
GRADUATED AND THAT YOU BECAME INTERESTED WHEN ASSIGNED TO WRITE AN
ARTICLE IN CONNECTION WITH THE DEDICATION OF A LABORATORY IN LAZEAR'S
HONOR. IS THAT THE CORRECT VERSION?

ALSO, CAN YOU TELL ME IF PLANS HAVE BEEN MADE FOR
THE PRESERVATION OF “BUILDING NO. 1” AT CAMP LAZEAR, WHOSE REDISCOVERY
YOU DESCRIBED IN YOUR ARTICLE?
THANKING YOU FOR ANY HELP YOU CAN GIVE, I AM,
